t: Jeremiah 8

“ ‘At*p that time, declares the Lord,*s the bones of the kings and officials of Judah, the bones of the priests and prophets, and the bones of the people of Jerusalem will be removed from their graves.

They will be exposed to the sun and the moon and all the stars of the heavens, which they have loved and served and which they have followed and consulted and worshiped. They will not be gathered up or buried, but will be like dung lying on the ground.
Wherever I banish them, all the survivors of this evil nation will prefer death to life, declares the Lord*s Almighty.’
Sin and Punishment
“Say*p to them, ‘This is what the Lord*s says: “ ‘When*pn people fall down, do they not get up? When*ld someone turns away, do they not return?
Why*ln then have these people turned away? Why*ld does Jerusalem always turn away? They*ln cling to deceit; they*ld refuse to return.

I*ln have listened attentively, but*ld they do not say what is right. None*ln of them repent of their wickedness, saying,*ld “What have I done?” Each*ln pursues their own course like*ld a horse charging into battle.

Even*ln the stork in the sky knows*ld her appointed seasons, and*ln the dove, the swift and the thrush observe*ld the time of their migration. But*ln my people do not know the*ld requirements of the Lord.*s
“ ‘How*pn can you say, “We are wise, for*ld we have the law of the Lord,”*s when*ln actually the lying pen of the scribes has*ld handled it falsely?
The*ln wise will be put to shame; they*ld will be dismayed and trapped. Since*ln they have rejected the word of the Lord,*s what*ld kind of wisdom do they have?

Therefore*ln I will give their wives to other men and*ld their fields to new owners. From*ln the least to the greatest, all*ld are greedy for gain; prophets*ln and priests alike, all*ld practice deceit.
They*ln dress the wound of my people as*ld though it were not serious. “Peace,*ln peace,” they say, when*ld there is no peace.

Are*ln they ashamed of their detestable conduct? No,*ld they have no shame at all; they*ld do not even know how to blush. So*ln they will fall among the fallen; they*ld will be brought down when they are punished, says*ld the Lord.*s

“ ‘I*pn will take away their harvest, declares*ld the Lord.*s There*ld will be no grapes on the vine. There*ln will be no figs on the tree, and*ld their leaves will wither. What*ln I have given them will*ld be taken from them.’ ”

Why*pn are we sitting here? Gather*ld together! Let*ln us flee to the fortified cities and*ld perish there! For*ln the Lord*s our God has doomed us to perish and*ld given us poisoned water to drink, because*ld we have sinned against him.
We*ln hoped for peace but*ld no good has come, for*ln a time of healing but*ld there is only terror.

The*ln snorting of the enemy’s horses is*ld heard from Dan; at*ln the neighing of their stallions the*ld whole land trembles. They*ln have come to devour the*ld land and everything in it, the*ld city and all who live there.
“See,*pn I will send venomous snakes among you, vipers*ld that cannot be charmed, and*ld they will bite you,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
You*pn who are my Comforter in sorrow, my*ld heart is faint within me.

Listen*ln to the cry of my people from*ld a land far away: “Is*ln the Lord*s not in Zion? Is*ld her King no longer there?” “Why*pn have they aroused my anger with their images, with*ld their worthless foreign idols?”
“The*pn harvest is past, the*ld summer has ended, and*ld we are not saved.”
Since*pn my people are crushed, I am crushed; I*ld mourn, and horror grips me.
Is*ln there no balm in Gilead? Is*ld there no physician there? Why*ln then is there no healing for*ld the wound of my people?
